meanings.definition: To repair or replace the heel of a shoe.
meanings.sent1: She reheeled her favorite boots after the heel broke.
meanings.sent2: The cobbler reheeled the worn-out shoes for the customer.
meanings.sent3: After tripping on a rock, she reheeled her shoe to avoid future accidents.
meanings.sent4: He reheeled his shoes with determination, ready to walk confidently again.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the hammer reheeling the shoe echoed in the workshop.

meanings.definition: To put a new heel on a shoe.
meanings.sent1: He reheeled his dress shoes before the important meeting.
meanings.sent2: The shoemaker reheeled the elegant pumps for the upcoming event.
meanings.sent3: She reheeled her shoes just in time for the dance, feeling like Cinderella.
meanings.sent4: The new heel reheeled her boots, making them look brand new.
meanings.sent5: With a few taps, the cobbler reheeled the shoe, restoring its balance.

meanings.definition: To fix or mend the heel of a shoe.
meanings.sent1: The repair shop reheeled the damaged shoe quickly.
meanings.sent2: She reheeled her favorite pair of sneakers to extend their life.
meanings.sent3: He reheeled his shoes with care, ensuring they would last longer.
meanings.sent4: The cobbler reheeled the worn-out boots, saving them from being thrown away.
meanings.sent5: Reheeling the shoe made it comfortable to wear again, like walking on clouds.
